venue.name: Iris & B. Gerald Cantor Art Gallery - Holy Cross College

item.description:
Portraits of American Trees

The Iris and B. Gerald Cantor Art Gallery at the College of the Holy Cross, 1 College Street, will present Tom Zetterstrom: Portraits of American Trees. The exhibition will be on view from August 25th through October 9th. A special opening reception will be held in the gallery on Thursday, September 16th from 4 -6:30 p.m., followed by a lecture by Zetterstrom in the Seelos Theatre 7:30-8:30 p.m.

Zetterstrom's photographic career spans more than forty years, beginning after his graduation from Colorado College and studies at the Pratt Institute. He taught photography in the late 1960s in Washington, D.C. and worked as a freelance photojournalist in the 70s and 80s for The New York Times Magazine, The New York Times op-ed pages, and A Day inthe Life of America.

Cantor Art Gallery is open Monday - Friday 10 a.m. - 5 p.m., Saturdays, 2-5 p.m. Admission to the gallery, reception and lecture is free.

College of the Holy Cross: Iris & B. Gerald Cantor Art Gallery
1 College Street
Worcester, MA 01610-2395

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Tom Zetterstrom: Portraits of American Trees- Lecture and Gallery Show
